parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Introduced in game</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70</value></part><part><name>Version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> A getter for [[allowDamage]] command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current [[local]]ity, hence local effect of the command. For complete solution for being able to tell whether or not an object can be damaged at current locality see '''Example 1'''.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[isDamageAllowed]] object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _canBeDamaged = [[local]] _obj && [[isDamageAllowed]] _obj;</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allowDamage]], [[setDamage]], [[setHit]]

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> This command only works locally. It always returns false when called on non local objects
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
</dl>
